newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Costello sees no media foreign limit change.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Costello sees no media foreign limit change.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Thursday he currently saw no need to change limits on foreign ownership of Australia's media.
"As yet, there has been no case put to us that has motivated us to look at changing those guidelines," Costello told Australian Broadcasting Corp radio.
Costello said the government's inquiry into media ownership would not look at foreign ownership limits.
"The media ownership review is looking at cross-media ownership requirements and that is the focus of its terms of reference. This is a different issue," he said.
Foreigners are limited to a maximum 25 percent holding.

Canadian media baron Conrad Black said on Wednesday he wanted to increase his stake in Australia's oldest newspaper group, John Fairfax Holdings Ltd, to 50 percent from 25 percent to create more stability for the group.
Black repeated he would sell out of Fairfax if there was no easing in the current media ownership rules, which he described as "anachronistic".
